sen.j: 藩庁（はんちょう）とは、江戸時代の日本の政治用語の一つ。
sen.e: Hancho is a political term used during the Edo period.

sen.j: 藩庁とは、幕藩体制下において、藩の役所が置かれたところ（城郭・屋敷）である。
sen.e: Hancho, where a domain's local office was set up, was located in a castle or a residence under the shogunate system.
Hancho was a place (a castle or a mansion) where the office of a domain was set up under the shogunate system.
sen.cmt: 「役所」ではなく「役所が置かれたところ」なのでplaceを入れました。また、「住宅」ではなく「屋敷」なのでresidenceからmansionに変えました。
sen.e: Hancho was a place (a castle or a mansion) where the office of a domain was set up under the shogunate system.

sen.j: 大名（藩主）や藩士が常駐し、藩の行政業務を執り行う。
sen.e: Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and hanshi (feudal retainer of domain) were stationed in hancho to handle the domain's administrative affairs.
Daimyo (feudal lord) and hanshi (feudal retainer of domain) were stationed in hancho to handle the domain's administrative affairs.
sen.cmt: ここではJapaneseは特に必要ないため削除しました。
sen.e: Daimyo (feudal lord) and hanshi (feudal retainer of domain) were stationed in hancho to handle the domain's administrative affairs.

sen.j: 大藩は城に藩庁を置き、小藩は陣屋と呼ばれる屋敷に藩庁を置いた。
sen.e: Large scale domains set up their own hancho in a castle, while small domains established their own ones in a residence called jinya.
Large scale domains set up their own hancho in a castle, and small domains in a mansion called jinya.
sen.cmt: 後半は動詞と目的語を省略できるので省略しました。Residenceは普通の住居の意味もあるので、「屋敷」の雰囲気を出すためにmansionで代用しました。
sen.e: Large scale domains set up their own hancho in a castle, and small domains in a mansion called jinya.

sen.j: なかには、藩庁を設けない「無陣屋」の藩もあった。
sen.e: Some domains did not set up their own hancho (domains without jinya [regional government office]).
Among them were some domains which did not set up their own hancho, and they were called ''mujinya (domains without regional government office).''
sen.cmt: 「なかには」の訳が抜けていたのでamong themを付け加えました。また「無陣屋」の説明の括弧が多いので減らし、読みやすいように書き換えました。
sen.e: Among them were some domains which did not set up their own hancho, and they were called ''mujinya (domains without regional government office).''

sen.j: 藩庁を中心に栄えた町を陣屋町といい、陣屋が城であった場合は城下町と呼ばれた。
sen.e: The towns that developed around hancho was called jinyamachi, while those that developed around a castle jokamachi (castle town).
sen.cmt: 「陣屋が城であった場合」は「城を中心に栄えた」としました。
sen.e: The towns that developed around hancho were called jinyamachi, and those that developed around a castle jokamachi (castle towns).
sen.cmt: townsと複数なのでそれに合わせてwasをwereに変えました。またwhileを使うと順番が日本語と逆になってしまうので、andでつなげました。最後に城下町は複数あるのでsをつけました。
sen.e: The towns that developed around hancho were called jinyamachi, and those that developed around a castle jokamachi (castle towns).
